website_summaries.verdict: Coleman is known for making quality outdoor gear, and this convenient tent is no exception. If you want a model made of sturdy material that's speedy to set up, this is the one to get.
pros: Owners rave about how fast and easy it is to set up – in as little as 5 seconds
Fits up to 4 people and does a better job than most at keeping the interior dry
cons: Challenging but not impossible to return to its carrying bag
Door zipper occasionally sticks, malfunctions, or breaks

customer_reviews.title: Loooooooove it
customer_reviews.text: Definitely buy the 4 person. Goes up as easy as expected. Super light. WATCH A YOUTUBE VIDEO ON HOW TO CLOSE IT! The instructions in the bag are of no help. lol
customer_reviews.author: Samantha L. Stull

customer_reviews.title: I would not ever recommend buying this tent
customer_reviews.text: Tent arrived in a torn poorly taped soaking wet box. I opened it try to use it once and the zipper was totally off the track on the door. There were threads of mesh everywhere along the tent seams where it was poorly sewn. It is impossible to fold this tent up it took me almost an hour. Things should not be this difficult when you’re on a family camping trip. I would not ever recommend buying this tent. It was poorly made and it is not an easy take down. Amazon did refund my money. Hurray for Amazon, BOOOO for Coleman. FIX YOUR ZIPPERS AND USE QUALITY POLES THAT DONT BREAK!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: This pop-up tent is very Convenience and so cute. It is very effective for simple camping . I love it!
customer_reviews.author: DONGDONG

customer_reviews.title: ... excited about getting this tent and to say I'm satisfied is an understatement
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited about getting this tent and to say I'm satisfied is an understatement! This is an INCREDIBLE value. We were in awe at how quickly it popped up. And to top it off it's easy to get back into the bag too!! (We followed the photo instructions the first time and then my husband got the hang of it!) can't wait to test out this in a couple weeks when we go camping, yay!!! These photos of course taken before being staked down. Bought this for my husband and I and our two year old son. This will hold us perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Atallman1223

customer_reviews.title: I 💖 Coleman
customer_reviews.text: Super cool and really nice! 4 person tent gives 1-2 people ample room. I'm glad I didn't get the 2 person, that would be ok for a kid or two.
customer_reviews.author: 3CatsKindOfGal

customer_reviews.title: YMMV - Was a nogo for me
customer_reviews.text: The setup was awesome. Teardown suck worse than anything. Sure the package has a QR code to scan for a video, but it goes to a broken link. If you stake the guywires it'll hold in the wind, but you may not be able to zip the doors without splitting the zippers. Fold down was a nightmare. Between the zippers and the 25mins it took to find a video with poor quality and get that damn thing back into the bag, ultimately i called it defective and am returning it. Maybe the 2p is better? It's roomy AF in there. But unless you really practive that takedown/fold up this tent isn't worth the easy set-up.
customer_reviews.author: Thîãš Lïght

customer_reviews.title: New Tent comes with Bird Poop!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't take a picture because I didn't have the means to do so, but I received my "new" Coleman 4 - Person pop-up tent today. My co-workers were curious, so I "set" it up in the yard while they watched. It went up quickly and easily as shown. Packing it up couldn't be done by the guys, but I didn't have a problem. Only thing that kind-of creeped me out was the bird poop that appeared to be on one end of the rain-fly of a brand new tent.(?) Are all of the tents tested prior to sale? Other than that I am totally pleased with my purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: LallyN

customer_reviews.title: Quick, dry, amazing!!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a tent that you can set up, in pitch black night, on uneven ground, while a storm is coming in with 30 mph gusts, and you're exhausted and 3 IPAs down for the night... CONGRATULATIONS! You have found it. Unsnap the strap that holds it together and in 5 sec you have a tent. 2 minutes to secure the stakes that come with it. Another 2 minutes to adjust the rainfly. Seriously, it took me longer to unroll the sleeping bag. Also, no 1 drop of water got in the tent and it was a vicious storm. I didn't treat the seams either... this was straight out of the box stellar performace.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Miller

customer_reviews.title: NOT waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Set up of this tent is a breeze, but caught in a downpour, the rain fly did very little to keep us dry. This is not a waterproof tent. Additionally, with the rainfly up, you can't see out the windows, so it's a little claustrophobia inducing. Still, for late night arrival at a campground, we were grateful to have a tent that set up in seconds. I'd use it again under clear skies, but wouldn't rely on this in unpredictable weather. You need to watch a Youtube video to learn how it closes back down, it's not intuitive and it's a 2 person job. Also, the zippers suck.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: QUICK set up. Take down is easy ONCE you learn the secret.
customer_reviews.text: We did a practice set up and take down in the house. Literally less than 5 second set up once bag is unzipped. After half an hour of trying to repack using the included instructions, I watched a YouTube video on how to do it. You want to get the fold up procedure correct before you take it out camping where you may not have internet available to help on the spot. Follow up..... I bought a second one because they are on sale. The zippers are cheap and will eventually break. Not great for rain protection...under an awning, another rain fly or some kind of cover works best for heavy condensation (Florida) or rain.
customer_reviews.author: Mike64

customer_reviews.title: It has lengthened my life!
customer_reviews.text: I hate camping. However, the ease with which this tent went up made me happy for just a moment, between trying to get everything else worked out. It's large enough for three people and extremely easy to put back into the bag. I still pray for death whenever it's time to go camping, but this tent makes me just a little less likely to hang myself from a tree.
customer_reviews.author: I. Guch

customer_reviews.title: This Type of Tent Breaks After 1 or 2 Uses
customer_reviews.text: The fiberglass poles embedded in these types of tents are absolutely useless after one or two uses – with a tent that requires folding up and repacking like these pop-ups do, even the slightest amount of tension can snap the cheap fiberglass poles used in its construction. Ours lasted just two trips – and since these items get a lot of wear, don’t expect yours to last for more than one season, if you’re lucky. I just open the tent with the intent to use it this afternoon – but now it’s worthless . Garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Nola and Michael K.

customer_reviews.title: EASY SET UP AND TAKE DOWN
customer_reviews.text: I am a single person and I cannot tell you how much I love this tent! it is so easy to set up and take town. I went camping with my family and they all thought I was crazy waiting to set up my tent. I took it out of the bag, and let it pop right up and they all were stunned at how quick I was done setting up for the night, when it took them 20 min and 3 people to set up their tents. I would consider buying more of these just as spares for my friends when I go camping.
customer_reviews.author: brunerlane628

customer_reviews.title: Why did they use fiberglass for the poles?
customer_reviews.text: I like the fast set up, it's the reason why I bought it. I read all they were saying about the zippers, and didn't want to rip the thing so I did not stake it down. I tried to put it back in the bag, and promptly broke the little fiberglass poles in 2 places. I got to use it one time. If the poles were metal, like the hampers this is designed after, that would not have happened. The tent has been deemed to fragile for camping, in my life. I would not buy another. I really wanted this to work, too.
customer_reviews.author: B. Courtright

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Car Camping! NON A 4 PERSON TENT! Not for backpacking...
customer_reviews.text: This ships in a large thin box. The tent is in a bag that is about 36” across and 4” thick. After removing from bag and the retention strap this pops open in the blink of an eye (no exaggeration) this is designed to be instant open. Perfect for car camping. Watch the YouTube video about how to put it back in the bag there is a slight trick to it. THIS IS NOT A 4 PERSON TENT! Perfect for 2 large adults with gear or (or a small child) Well vented. The door has a tricky zipper (when the tent is staked down and it is under tension)
customer_reviews.author: David Khachadoorian

customer_reviews.title: Maybe
customer_reviews.text: Many other reviewers have mentioned trouble with closing the door when staked down. This is true. The reason is the polls are trimmed too long so that the material is held too tight this can be fixed by a handy individual. But since I have to take extra time to to fix a fairly expensive product it gets two stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Man Jack

customer_reviews.title: Broken Zipper on first use
customer_reviews.text: Was genuinely excited to use this on a kayak and camping trip , My friends were in awe of the fun of it instantly poping into shape , but after hoping in the tent for the first time to check it out , The zipper came off the track of teeth for the bottom of the tent door making it impossible to close and also turning what should have been a enjoyable trip into a hassle
customer_reviews.author: Brian O'Donnell

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up; tricky to pack up again. I can get it after like 5-10 minutes of fiddling with it. It's not difficult per se, just not intuitive. If you got practiced with it, you could probably pack it up in under a minute. Because of reviews about the design defect regarding waterproofing the door, I applied silicon spray to the whole thing and bought an inexpensive tarp to set up over it if heavy rain is expected. This both keeps the water completely off of the tent and also gives a waterproof front porch area in front of it so you can dry off and not track mud into the tent. It's a good combo.
customer_reviews.author: T. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Sh:+ zippers ruin an otherwise ok design. Don't buy this one.
customer_reviews.text: Would not buy again. The zipper to the screen door broke on the first pull. The full door broke later that night. And I mean profoundly broke- it took 45 minutes to get the tent closed after dark. As other reviewers mentioned, you can't stake the tent if you plan to zip it later. Can't. Not a user-error issue. It does set up like a dream. It will be a fine backyard play thing. I could see it being good for a day at the beach. Just not a night.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great for quick trips!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this tent after I found out that my kids had two single night camping trips in two weeks. Setting up and tearing down camp is exhausting! This tent goes up and comes down very easily. My family of four slept comfortably, although at 5’4” I was touching the the top and bottom of the tent while sleeping on the side. Next time we will sleep in the middle and put the kids on the sides. I wouldn’t recommend this for an extended camping trip, and the tent comes in a very awkward bag, making it difficult to carry for any extended time. But, for a quick up and down, this is definitely wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: EmilyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Faulty zipper design
customer_reviews.text: Tent goes up very easy, just as described. I was also able to get it folded down pretty easily after watching a video on it. The problem is that you cannot zip the door closed, either with the tent staked down, or without. There's too much tension, making it impossible to zip closed. Makes the tent pretty useless. I already threw out the shipping box, and would return it if it wasn't such a hassle. Should have listened to the other reviews noting the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: S. DeBoer

customer_reviews.title: Good easy up tent
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome. Easy to put up. Slightly harder to put down. You literally just throw it and it puts up ready to go, like something out of Harry Potter or Star Trek. Do yourself a favor though and watch one of those videos on how to take it down first and pay attention to how it is folded up when you take it out of the package and you will be just fine. It took 6 seconds to put it up and about five minutes to take it down and put it back in the case. The case is awesome and zippered. It gets the tent pretty flat. It slept two people plus gear comfortably with room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: DEE1

customer_reviews.title: Very great tent, was able to sleep 3 people with plenty of room
customer_reviews.text: So, I have had this tent for three months and let me just say wow! This tent is one of a kind! It holds up great in heavy rain and wind if the ropes to the side are tied down. The first time I camped in this... I had a ball, I slept like a baby with me and 2 friends plus my big German shepherd! I would recommend though putting a tarp under this tent when camping to prevent moisture. But overall. This without a doubt gets a god 5 stars and I will continue to use this tent!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Moss

customer_reviews.title: So simple!!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy set up!! Putting it away is a bit difficult. The directions in the book are not very clear so we had to look up a video on youtube. After watching it, its no longer a struggle. Its short! Maybe 3 feet high. But it fit me, my husband, my 10 year old daughter and 17 year old son with out us being all squished up against each other. Love not struggling with poles and spending 2-3 hours of our camping trips pitching and dismantling the tent. Would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Tent
customer_reviews.text: This has to one of the best purchases for my kids. They love to camp, inside, outside, in the family room....you get it. What used to be chore and time consuming hardly takes any time at all wit this pop up tent. It's been used 20 times or more now and it's still in great shape. Set up is a breeze and it easily fits two to three people. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Easy
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent. Super easy and fast to pitch and collapse. Used to have a Cabela's Alaskan Guide tent which was really nice, but super heavy and took about an hour to set up. Yeah, there are a couple of trade-offs with the Coleman - not as big and not as watertight. But its ease in set-up and light weight is well worth the trade off. My only wish is that it folded down a bit smaller. Would be nice to have this collapse to a size that would be easier to carry as a backpacker.
customer_reviews.author: Gregor

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, easy pop-up, lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: I liked this tent was easy to put up but hard to get back in bag it came in. It did not leak in light rainfall but not sure how it would hold up in a hard windy rainy night. It sleeps 2 people with twin air mattresses but no room for rest of camping gear. Also a regular size cot and a twin mattress will fit in well but not 2 cots. This tent was made for 2 people to sleep in comfortably but not 4 people as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Vivyan Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Loving this tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is really easy to set up and, once you get the moves down, easy to pack up. I camped in the desert so have not had any rain experience yet. My only cons are that the screen part of the door is not able to be full screen (only halfish) and the opposite side of the door has no windows at all so you can't see behind the tent easily. This trip was just me in my giant sleeping bag and a chihuahua. I could see how you could get at least 2 adults in comfortably with clothing bags, but I don't think 4 would be very happy campers.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Beware the zipper
customer_reviews.text: In using this tent on the 3rd use the zipper already malfunctioned. When more than one person is in this tent the zipper gets too tight and ends up losing it's zip and you have to fiddle with it to catch track again. This really would be a great tent if only the zipper were better quality. I still use it even with this malfunction. It works amazing in the rain (when the zipper decides to work) and stays VERY dry. I also LOVE how it stores flat! It is super easy to store and has a lot of space when you open it! Comfortably fits 3 adults but I have fit 4 and a dog.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Easy set-up!!
customer_reviews.text: We got to our campsite at like 11 pm, so it was SO nice to just pop open the tent, BAM, and it was ready to go!! It was literally setup in less than a minute, just had to insert the spikes to keep it in place. We weren't able to figure out how to fold it back up to fit in the case it came in, though, and my son broke the zipper on the screen to the door, but otherwise it was awesome. We slept four to the tent (me & three boys ages 9-14) snugly, and the skylights were wonderful, I had a beautiful view of the starry night from mine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: At least the return and refund was easy.
customer_reviews.text: We were so hopeful with this tent at the time of purchase but unfortunately we were instantly disappointed when we open the one of the poles was already snapped & broken making our camping trip very difficult. With the pole being snapped it was almost impossible to zip a zipper closed not to mention folding backup was extremely dangerous. With a lot of tension & two sharp poles I felt like I was going to be stabbed. Thankfully the refund and return was quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Geremy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent
customer_reviews.text: Nice little tent for under $100. I got mine on sale for $60 even better. Lots of room, nice design and color. It's not small when packed down but it's flat. Love the pop up. Only downside is that the screens aren't to the floor, so my dog can't see out and the door design can let water drip in when you're zipping and unzipping. Otherwise, nice stargazing tent with screens on the top. I had it out in the rain with just the little fly and it was dry.
customer_reviews.author: L. Skutch

customer_reviews.title: Impressed my friend.
customer_reviews.text: It didn’t leak and it was, as advertised, super easy to set up and take down. The look on my friends face when I pulled it out of the carrier and threw it at the cleared site was worth the $50. He had a much sterdier tent but I was finished with setup in about 12 seconds. Well, 2 minutes with staking it down, but you get the idea. Tear down was about as easy. Pulled the stakes and folded it in half twice and stuffed it back in the bag. Very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: B. Berger

customer_reviews.title: Lazy approved!
customer_reviews.text: Smartest thing I bought for camping! If you're lazy like me then this is the right tent for you! Lol
customer_reviews.author: @fadedroach

customer_reviews.title: Time Saver Tent
customer_reviews.text: I spend a lot of time camping/fishing. As for myself I tend to hate the time wasted (impatient) setting up a regular tent. I'm ust a bit over eager to begin exploring or fishing once arriving at a campsite. I highly recommend this product based on brand, the ease of set up, & disassembly and pricing. Now storage wise, not bulky, it lays flat, approximate circumference measurement to be about 3ft. Could be an inconvience to some with a small vehicle trying to transport other gear as well. Overall rating 5 Star...
customer_reviews.author: D.Lucero_NOT_RETURNED

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this 0 stars I would, got this for my son to take his son camping. It popped up and when he tried to zipper it closed the zipper tore away from the material. This will be going back as soon as they get home😡
customer_reviews.author: Pat P

customer_reviews.title: I love this tent just wish I could have something to hang a light.
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent. Only thing I wish it had was a place to hang my light. I’d love to hang it in the middle of the tent so we can have some light at night and not have to worry about it getting covered or whatever. But all in all outside of there’s no place to hang a light it’s a good tent. My girl and I have took it out afew times. Also bringing our dogs, I have a bluenose pit her has a little Chihuahua terrier and we have plenty of room in the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Tru

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent!
customer_reviews.text: WOW... INSTANT UP IS NO JOKE. This thing was amazing. Literally 2 minutes to set up INCLUDING the stakes! The bad... it is that it is a little small. I would say you have enough room for a queen size (non-raised) air bed and your gear but that is about it. Also it is not good for a back packing tent. Its overall profile is pretty large in its closed form. It folds up super flat but is not something you could back pack with... I know this sounds trivial but figured I would let you know if that is what you are thinking of buying it for. Still I love this tent!
customer_reviews.author: George Tabbert III

customer_reviews.title: Great for quick setup camp outs
customer_reviews.text: The tent is great for quick setup but be mindful of the trade off there are issues with it but if you are careful to adjust your setup it's perfect for single night camp outs. The problem I have with it is that the zipper will not work to close the door if the tent is properly steaked down. And can be a headache at time but if you account for this and setup loosely it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Aviles

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy material. It ripped just by slightly tugging on an edge to straighten it. Waste of a lot of money. A refund would be nice since I didn’t use this item and used our old tent. I was so excited as it looked perfect for my 10yr old and I for a chill weekend. Thankfully I followed review suggestions and opened it before leaving.
customer_reviews.author: Beckybec

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is amazing. It sets up instantly and is perfect for a quick camping trip. I bought this for my 10 year old son so we can do camp outs in our yard. I ended up buying another one for my brother and his kids. The instructions for closing it were a little confusing so I went on YouTube and watched a video. It takes under a minute to close if you watch a video.
customer_reviews.author: Cmeehan

customer_reviews.title: Simple and quick
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent!! I got my son the 2 man variety for Christmas as he is getting ready to crossover into Boy Scouts. He loved it so much I got myself the 4 man version for when my younger kids and I do cubscputs, and for my woodbadge training. The ONLY downside I have is that when the tent is wet or it’s raining the unzipped door hangs into the tent. We ended up making a tarp awning to solve the problem. It’s well made and watertight (barring door issue) and super respond set up and take down. I would purchase again for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everything i expected
customer_reviews.text: I got it, opened it, and put it back in its bag. This was the easiest tent ive ever set up. And the instructions to fold it back up were just as easy. Its spacious too. Maybe not big enough for 4 adults or grown men but definitely 3 with gear. There was some mix up with the delivery(at first) but it finally got here ok. Someone mentioned the zipper being difficult, i stuck my 12 year old inside the tent and she had no problem getting in and out of it from the inside. Ill repost after running it through a field test
customer_reviews.author: Adam Ghering

customer_reviews.title: PRACTICE PRACTICE PRACTICE !!
customer_reviews.text: I can not stress how much you need to practice folding this thing back up because it took me 40 min of trial and failure to get it. The instructions where horrible. I basically looked like a fool for 30 min, Other than that I like the tent. The bottom is not Waterproof though so make sure to bring a mattress even tho it says it is waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: PeanutColada

customer_reviews.title: Its an "ok" tent to begin with. I bought ...
customer_reviews.text: Its an "ok" tent to begin with. I bought it to take on outings to the beach and possible car camping. However packing it away is beyond frustrating. the packing details don't tell you the trick to getting back into the bag. Even after watching the few Youtube videos it requires a lot of time and patience.
customer_reviews.author: SemperTerp

customer_reviews.title: Item was used and broken
customer_reviews.text: Took this camping and my son couldn’t close the zipper as it was broken as well as the screen had a hole in it. How disappointing. He couldn’t use it and had to squeeze in my tent. This is terrible and disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Godess4lfe

customer_reviews.title: This one broke way too easy on the fold up and it also did not ...
customer_reviews.text: This tent broke on the 1st set up and take down. I have had these tents before and I'm very familiar with how to fold them back up into a circle. This one broke way too easy on the fold up and it also did not even come with it rain fly. Very poor quality I tried returning it and I got the runaround from the company on return shipping. They said I had to ship it and because of the size it was going to be $70. I took it in the shorts on this one do not buy this tent
customer_reviews.author: Josh Corbett

customer_reviews.title: Fastest tent I've ever set up!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is amazing! Easy to set up, easy to take down. (Just watch a video before-hand, it helps to see it being done in motion and not just pictures!) As usual, however, I would not call this a 4-person tent. (unless you are a sardine) This would fit 2 people fairly comfortably (with limited gear and on sleep mats, not giant air mattresses) and one person in luxury with room for gear. The seams are all taped, and the material seems like typical quality Coleman construction. When collapsed and packed in it's bag, it's fairly large in diameter but still very lightweight and easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pop up tent, nice and easy to set up and store away
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this tent! It’s so fun and easy to set up our kids can set it up alone with little assistance. We always have family camping with friends and families and all the kids want one too. I love how it barely takes up any space and literally folds flat for storage. Glad we got one and we continue to use it year after year
customer_reviews.author: SuperDad

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tent! Afforable, durable, easiest tent you will ever set up. Watch the videos on how to fold it back up- it helps to have 2 people do it. I do suggest sizing up and getting a 4 person for 2 people. The 4 person tent even has enough room for a queen sized air mattress if you need some extra cushion. This tent has kept me and my gear completely dry in very heavy rain with the rain flys staked down. I'm an avid camper and I 100% recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Great, easy tent.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. This tent was very easy to set up. Taking down is easy once you get the hang of it. Practice a few times before you camp and you should be fine. Keep the door zipped close while staking down tent and you won't have an issue with zipping and unzipping. It is a little large to carry around as a 4 foot circle. 4 person tent fits a queen size air mattress with room for a duffle bag.
customer_reviews.author: Antcal

customer_reviews.title: Goods and bads
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Held up in a rain storm with no water coming in. Was my first time camping and was worried that it would be a very bad turn out but I felt secured in the tent. Zipper is very iffy. It's a bit too wide to fit in the trunk of a car (2018 Chevy cruze) so keep that in mind when packing or traveling with it.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Yerena

customer_reviews.title: Sets up within seconds, travel friendly great for a hike campout!
customer_reviews.text: So far we love it! We have a 16 person dome tent but it's hard to keep warm at night, we got this to set up inside of it or for those spontaneous camping nights! Very roomy and could fit 4 Adults comfortably, great for our family of 5 and the dog! However, its impossible for me to fold it up small enough to fit back into the carrying bag..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ended up giving it away.
customer_reviews.text: The tent will not zip closed when it is staked down. The door was too small which means that while camping, you either had to stake it down and leave the door open all night for the bugs to come in or not stake it down and have the wind blow your tent around (I mean like the wacky, inflatable, flailing arm tube man). I ended up giving it to someone who never owned a tent before so they could at least have something. But I was not happy giving it to them or happy with my purchase in general. Used it once and will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kale

customer_reviews.title: Great design!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Fits a queen air mattress with room all around although I would not call it a "4-person" tent. Set up is as easy as claimed. Fold up....well if I didn't have a truck windshield sun-screen of a similay design I would never have gotten it back in the bag using only the provided instructions. WATCH THE YOUTUBE VIDEOS! Other than folding it is the best tent I have ever used. Certainly worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Fun
customer_reviews.text: My grandchildren have this set up in their playroom They are having a blast with it. One drawback- it really is tricky to close up, so my daughter has left it in the playroom to replace their homemade fort. It's just a little to difficult for her to pack it up and take it with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia

customer_reviews.title: Put away awful pole snapped run away
customer_reviews.text: Easy 10 second set up, but take down is AWFUL!!!! After 45 minutes of trying to "fold and tuck" like the instructions say, the poles snapped. So there goes $50 bucks down the toilet. Have one more to put away, but pretty sure it will result in my family yelling at each other. I was so excited to try, but now I regret it as I am probably going to have to throw away $100 in tents.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Not Waterproof. So waterproof it.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews on this tent. I knew what I was getting. Saved money by buying a couple of cans of waterproof sealer and sprayed it with about three coats before using it. Water rolls off it like a Duck's back now. No worries mate. All in all it's a great tent otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS E FAGAN

customer_reviews.title: Fragile Zippers and terrible in the wind
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend and I are avid campers, we decided this seemed to be an inexpensive option as an easy summer pop up when you don't need much for a tent. While it is extremely easy to set up and only a little tricky to take, where it absolutely failed was design. There are many areas on the "fly" that cannot be fastened and will flap in the wind, making for a very annoying sound all evening. Along with that discovery one of the zippers broke first use, It seems to be designed with far too much tension on the door panel section. Lastly I would never want to be in the rain in this. I will be getting something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO SET UP
customer_reviews.text: IT WAS A LITTLE IFFY AS TO THE DURABILITY OF THIS TENT. ONE OF THE ZIPPERS KEPT ACTING LIKE IT WASN'T GOING TO WORK. PROBABLY WON'T LAST LONG. IT WAS A NIGHTMARE TO GET BACK INTO IT'S POUCH IT IS STORED IN. I HAVE PUT UP ANOTHER TENT OF THIS SAME DESIGN A MILLION TIMES SO I KNOW HOW BUT THIS ONE WAS JUST REALLY CUMBERSOME.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Melville

customer_reviews.title: Super easy set up and take down (5 min max if you take your time staking it down)
customer_reviews.text: Used it several times in windy and rainy conditions. Stayed dry and was not worried about it blowing away. Stake it down carefully and the zipper works fine without forcing it. The other scout leaders were a bit in awe when I popped it up and was done setting up in less than 5 min. I would buy it again and may get the smaller one for a canoe trip next summer.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tent. Great for 1-2 adults. 4 adults would be cramped. 3 boy scouts fit just fine. 1 person can setup and take down in seconds. Take down requires a little practice. Watch videos on it. Used a tarp under it as the floor is thin. It rained a little bit and we stayed dry. The only problem is the zippers. It can be very difficult to zip close when staked down. But for this little problem it would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: charles c cantrell

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke
customer_reviews.text: I love the size of this tent. Super easy to set up. Fairly easy to tear down and store. The problem is the zipper. I noticed the first time I used it that it was hard to zip. The second time I used it, the screen ripped trying to zip it up and over night, the zipper pull came off the track. I could not get it back on track and had to rip my way out. Total waste of $. Very disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: Wm Marty Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, but needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: In theory, this tent is great. Unfortunately, when you stake it down with the rainfly, the tension is too much for the zipper to handle. If you don't use the stakes and guy lines, then this tent works great. Had it in a rain storm, did pretty well, but the broken zipper caused a small puddle at the door. Easy to set up, easy to take down. Coleman, fix this problem and I'll give you 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J D

customer_reviews.title: Zipper split when staked down
customer_reviews.text: I loved the idea of this tent. I purchased it to use an outside play area for my 7 month old with the option to use it camping. Worked perfect for a baby play pen. But using it as a camping tent was disappointing. The zipper split. Luckily it didn’t rain. By the time I used it as a camping tent it was beyond the time for warranty replacement. If I could rate it as a zero star I would.
customer_reviews.author: Dani Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to deploy
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to deploy. Instructions for collapsing the tent could have been a little clearer- as it did leave me confused for a while, but aside from that I'm very happy with this purchase. "4-person" is a bit stretching it, but I am pleased with the size. I can sleep myself, (6'1", 200lbs) and my 8, and 10 year olds in here fine. Any more than 2 adults would be pushing it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bologna

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent, but beware... When the bottom is staked I can't get the door to zip shut.
customer_reviews.text: Love the tent and it is plenty spacious for 2 people. Could fit a third but no way to squeeze in a fourth unless you are stacked on top of each other. My only MAJOR complaint is the zippers on the front door. Once the tent has things in it and the bottom is flattened its nearly impossible to close the door. I had to even return my first one due to it breaking the zippers and not closing. That made for an odd camping experience with a door which wouldn't close for privacy. I have not tested out my new one, but with the door closing issue I'm weary it will have the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: VRWizard

customer_reviews.title: Did the job, but the hardest tent to fold for being a pop up
customer_reviews.text: This tent was great, however I do not recommend a queen size air mattress as it just barely fit in the tent. It also took me, a neighbor and my friend quite some time to get this thing folded once we opened it. The directions aren't explained very well, you tube videos make it so easy, but we had a challenge. Maybe it's just us,...lol, but over all it was a sturdy tent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Value for money but has some quirks
customer_reviews.text: The pop-up tent is very easy to setup and pack up. It could hold 4 tiny people or 2 normal sized humans with their luggage and a dog. The zipper is a little tight at some places - pulls the fabric and stretches the stitches. It's a little concerning as I feel like this may tear over time with usage. It rained during our camping and we had some leaks through the seam of the tent at a few places. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Revuru

customer_reviews.title: Held up just fine in a florida rainstorm
customer_reviews.text: Other user reviews created clear expectations for what product is and is not. The styling and opening flap are well thought out. Held up just fine in a florida rainstorm. Be cautious on opening the flap as it can let water inside if you are careless. No way would the smaller size accommodate 2 people as this one was ok for 2 of us average sized people. Popped up in seconds. Putting it back in the bag takes a bit of an origami twisting trick. I recommend having the ap on hand with the video instruction on folding it up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied my checklist
customer_reviews.text: Would have been nice if the folded up storage footprint was half as big, but how can I complain with a throw-and-go tent requiring zero setup effort? Seems quality, bigger than expected, could definitely sleep 2 with room to roll and 4 arm-to-arm.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: So easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: So easy to set up. My 7 year old grandson took it upon himself to be the one to take to his room and open..... it was like a sitcom episode where they open an inflatable raft in a closet! Thank goodness folding up was just as easy. Searched YouTube then went to his room and put it back in the package. Then setup in the front yard and really like the size, setup, and foldup.
customer_reviews.author: FreeSpirit

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Trustworthy, Tent
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent, took it on an 11 night primitive camping trip and it held up superbly even with packing it up and resetting it in new locations each night. Great in the rain even! Set up so fast, when I came home, I showed my 5 year old granddaughter how to set it up and the folded it up for her to start from scratch. She set the whole tent up with only the help of muscle to set the pegs into out Texas clay soil. I did not experience the door difficulty read about in other reviews; however, the door was always zipped up BEFORE staking down. That may be the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Asbill

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3 hours...
customer_reviews.text: Great tent for easy set up. One star because the first time we went camping this year, one of the poles snapped halfway up the side of the main door opening only 3 hours after setting it up. There is a lot of pressure on these poles due to the design. I expected more from this brand as I have found them to be very reliable over the years. Too bad we did not go camping before the time was up for being able to return this one. So we are stuck with a broken, useless bunch of tent fabric.
customer_reviews.author: C Hendricksen

customer_reviews.title: Huge!
customer_reviews.text: This is an Awesome product! I had a smaller two man beach pop up and it was hard to fit wife and I. This tent is huge
customer_reviews.author: BJ Brown

customer_reviews.title: Love the design, but it is not durable.
customer_reviews.text: Love the design, but it is not durable. We used it once and multiple seams came apart so we ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Boomer

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for one person set up!
customer_reviews.text: This tent has exceeded my expectations! I was eager and opened it in my living room and it's much bigger than I expected! I usually just camp with my dog, but the two person tent I had wasn't enough space for the two of us and my cot. This tent will have room for all of that and more! It's spacious and I really like the shape of it and the way the door unzips. I can't wait to get this out to the woods asap! Will update if anything detrimental happens during the first few trips, otherwise, my 5 stars stand! :)
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend watching it
customer_reviews.text: Watched a video ten times on how to put it back in the little bag...highly recommend watching it :) but love this tent and bought 2 of them. So nice to just give it a little toss and BAM, its up!!! BUT, the door sticks and material is too tight and pulls...and on one of mine it broke :( so I had to safety pin a sarong to it like a door. Thank goodness I was in an area without tons of insects or little animals.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So easy, perfect tent for lazy campers
customer_reviews.text: The best camping purchase ever. Ridiculously quick to open and set up. It basically pitches itself. Can’t stand up in it but I’ll trade that for an easy set up any day. Husband, big dog, and I all sleep in it comfortably with plenty of room for us and our bags.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mielke

customer_reviews.title: This is a 1-2 person tent.  Better have good knees too.
customer_reviews.text: Realistically, this tent will fit 1 person comfortably and 2 people snuggly. The floor does not measure big enough for a queen air mattress. If you only need it for yourself (or want to be cozy with that special someone) and don't mind bending and kneeling it might be a nice tent. Set up and take down take seconds, which is amazing. I have to return it as it does not fit my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Weak zipper, broke within 10 minutes
customer_reviews.text: The zipper is really fragile. It split apart in the middle of a night when it rained. Ended up in a puddle of water in the morning. I had few Coleman tents before, but never had such a weak zipper, it feels like a toy. Big plus in this tent is a pop up set up, however, putting it back together is not that easy, and takes some practice.
customer_reviews.author: EW

customer_reviews.title: Great tent that is EZ
customer_reviews.text: Went camping with this tent, setup in less than 2mintues, while others were still trying to set theirs up. Just remove from bag and stand back. Poof. Instant tent. We fit a family of 5 (2 adults and 3 children) comfortably in the tent. We love this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Watch a video to repack
customer_reviews.text: Most fun tent to set up. Haven’t camped with it yet, but I will waterproof spray this thing to make sure no water gets in since people think of this as medium duty as far as weather goes. Reassembling this for the first time was a challenge while just looking at the instructions, but eventually figured it out and reduced pack down time to under a minute.
customer_reviews.author: James Turvey

customer_reviews.title: Easy & Convenient but sizing is off.
customer_reviews.text: Once you get the "Taco" method of folding down, it was quite easy to put away. I went with my 5yr-old & it fit us quite comfortably. But, if 4ppl are actually supposed to fit in here, they'd have to be really, REALLY friendly with each other & love to spoon - because that's the only way 4ppl would actually fit.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: The worse part of tents is the time & effort to put them together, this takes all of that away! I’d say it would sleep 3 people comfortably but not sure about 4? Took a minute to get the folding right but it’s definitely easier with two people. Great price for a stress free tent!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Kinda fun hate the zippers
customer_reviews.text: Its a fair weather tent. I wouldn’t trust it to to protect in much of a storm at all. Like in many other reviews I had quite a bit of trouble with the zippers with the tent is staked down so I just tied out the rain fly but the zippers were still difficult once the air mattress was in. It’s actually kind of fun to throw it and watch it pop open in the air. I don’t regret buying this tent but I also can’t recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Amatth

customer_reviews.title: Fast Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: We had a regular tent that we used once and it was a really big pain to set up and take down. This thing is awesome. Pull it out the bag and WOOSH! A tent! hammer down some spikes and make yourself a drink. It definitely takes some practice to coil it back up, but it is doable and once you get it, it is like riding a bike. I actually like the round shape of it when it is packed up, it was easy to slide on top of all my other camping gear.
customer_reviews.author: NMG

customer_reviews.title: so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It was so easy to set this tent up! My 11 year old grandson shook it open and set it up in about 30 seconds. We love it! I went camping this weekend in Colorado and it poured. The tent stayed perfectly dry. I went inside my Element during a short hail storm, there was so much weight on the tent, it kind of collapsed. After it stopped hailing, I went out shook the hail off and it popped right back up. It is so much easier to come to a campsite and not have to deal with poles, you are set up within a minute. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: melanie

customer_reviews.title: Not for use in rain
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this a handful of times with no issues with clear skies. I just used it this past weekend and we hit some heavy storm, and the water soaked right through the bottom and we ended up sleeping in a wet tent. Luckily we had an air mattress that kept us off the ground. Would not recommend if there is a chance of rain.
customer_reviews.author: sones

customer_reviews.title: Zipper TOTALLY broken
customer_reviews.text: pretty upset with this one. took it camping for the first time and the zipper is totally broken. I have two dogs that I had to keep tied to me ALL THREE nights!! it was miserable. I read the reviews so I knew not to expect an actual 4 person tent nor did my Coleman cot fit in this. but for the convenience of set up and take down I didn't mind. I do really want to like this tent so I wish I could return it for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Bree

customer_reviews.title: Super fast setup and takedown.
customer_reviews.text: A great tent for camping. Quick and easy to setup and take down and store. Handled high wind and rain on my last trip with no problem. I would like to see heavier spikes but still worked great. Lightweight and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sr Ken

customer_reviews.title: Watch out when opening!😂
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous tent. Funny story though...beware opening the tent and be cautious where you open it. I opened ours in my sons room and it opened with such force, it hit one of his football helmets into the window and shattered the window😂😂😂. I didn’t have any problem folding it back up but find it to be a two person folding process. Also, the gray flap of fabric that covers the zipper, I cut that off because it kept getting stuck in the zipper.
customer_reviews.author: k625

customer_reviews.title: "On the go" camping made easy!
customer_reviews.text: I love watching my friends and family when their jaws drop just how easy and convenient this tent really is. Just remove from bag, remove strap holding tent together and throw in the air. The tent literally assembles itself. I've had mine a few years and it's still standing strong. I will say however that even though folding the tent is incredibly easy. I had difficulties understanding the instructions and had to YouTube how to put it away. I'm a pro now and can assemble and disassemble my tent in just under three minutes. This is definitely a must have for "on the go" camping!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Goes up easily, but is a bear to take down and ...
customer_reviews.text: Goes up easily, but is a bear to take down and fold without practice. It can be done though! The downside I discovered is the tent's performance in the wind. The rain fly catches the wind, "inflates" and directs the wind right into the tent. I was not expecting that. Given that the rain fly isn't very large, I wasn't expecting condensation either. There was a lot of condensation. I'm not unhappy with the tent, but I will be very cautious as to the conditions I choose to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Julie W.

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: This was a great idea but the zippers will not work. I bought it and used it over a month later and now I am stuck with a tent that does not close because it has been over 30 days for me to get my money back or get another one. I have a lot of Coleman products for camping but this was terrible. It get cold in the mountains in Oregon and my son and I had to be bundled up just to stay warm enough to be able to sleep at night. I also got the 4 person one and it was just enough for my son who is 17 and I. Dj
customer_reviews.author: dj yemane

customer_reviews.title: This Tent Is Worth Every Penny!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent because I like to go on last minute, overnight camping trips but I hate setting up and taking down my tent. The Coleman 4 person pop up tent sets up/takes down in less than 5 minutes and is effortless. No folding or rolling! The last time I used this tent it was windy and raining and the pop up withstood it all with ease. I would recommend this tent to anybody who doesn't like setting up tent. However, do not plan to sleep more than 2 people in the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Loving it!
customer_reviews.text: Great tent! Like everyone else i had trouble getting it back into its disc shape but after a few times the penny dropped and its as easy as it should be to fold it back up. Like all 4 person tents, this is great for 2 unless you are stick people. its a big disc so its not for hiking, but for car camping you wont find easier. Its a Coleman so its well made. My only complaint about the tent, and why its not 5 stars, is that its hard to zip up from the inside because its so stretched out when set up.
customer_reviews.author: Typo Knig

customer_reviews.title: Good first tent
customer_reviews.text: Went travelling for a couple of weeks, first time camper! Very good for 2 people, maybe that's why it said 4 :D a lot of space inside! Very compact, but collapsing it will take some practising. Oh, don't forget to bring mats, since it has a very thin bottom. We had mats and an inflatable matress, which worked fine
customer_reviews.author: Ramil

customer_reviews.title: Love the tent, the carrying case does not hold up after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: Love the ease of this tent. I suggest watching a youtube video on how to put it up. Just wish the carrying case was more durable as it ripped after just a few uses. A little duct tape & it will be just fine, but that is my only critique. Many people approached me about where I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley L.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for casual or beginner campers.
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent. It is well worth its price in my opinion. It takes a certain technique in order to folded back into its case but it's not difficult at all. The case is pretty large so I would not recommend it to those who wish to buy a backpacking tent. However, I would highly recommend this to any casual or beginner camper. The inside of the tent is a decent size as well. Even though it's advertised as being a 4-person tent I do not forsee 4 people sleeping in it comfortably. It can fit 2 adults just fine though which is why I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Trenkamp

product_meta.title: Coleman 4-Person Pop-Up Tent
product_meta.description: Great for festivals and car camping, the Coleman 4-Person Pop-Up Tent sets up in as little as 10 seconds, letting you get back to the fun. This camping tent is uniquely designed with preassembled poles that allow the tent to pop into place in a snap. The taped floor seams keep you dry even when the ground is soaking wet, while the multiposition rainfly allows you to find the perfect balance of protection and ventilation. This backpacking tent offers enough room for 4 camp pads and comes with integrated storage pockets to help you keep small items organized. This 4-person tent folds flat for simple storage and is lightweight for easy portability.
feature_bullets: Taped floor seams help keep you dry
Multi-position rainfly for the perfect balance of protection and ventilation
Packs up flat for easy storage
Two storage pockets to organize your gear

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
